result.execSummary:
The defendant Laura Ann Zimit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laura Ann Zimit in court with attorney Joseph H. Loso.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:32 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances - Atty Loso will waive Judge Yackel getting off the case they are comfortable going forward with him hearing the plea hearing.  Court addressed Ms. Zimit as to this situation.  Defendant does wish to go forward today.  Atty Loso makes further stmt.  State moved to amend count 1 to straight DC with a fine.  Atty Loso agrees and tenders plea questionnaire to the Court.  Court grants motion to amend count 1 to straight DC.  Defendant entered plea of nC.  Court questions defendant as to plea questionnaire.  Parties stipulate to probalbe cause. State makes arguement.  Atty Loso makes arguement.  

Court finds defendant guilty $768.00 including costs given 60 days to pay or set up payment plan with a $15.00 payment plan fee

No abusive Contact with Alyssa Zimit.
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "    " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, no consumption of alcohol.  No consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Laura Ann Zimit in court with attorney Joseph H. Loso.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEF requests Jury Trial.  Final pre trial set for 8-18-15 10:00 am,  Jury Trial #3 set for 9-11-15.   
DEF requests bond modification, wants no contact provision reduced to no violent contact.   Atty Poquette waives notice of motion and objects to bond modification.
Atty Loso further argues for modification. Court grants modification of bond.
